SENT.plain: In patients with arrhythmias, the most feared complication while driving is of driver incapacity resulting in a road traffic accident
Patients with implantable cardioverter-defibrillators (ICDs) may suffer incapacity as a result of device therapy itself

The aim of this review article was to examine the types of arrhythmia that occur while driving, the impact of arrhythmia on driving as well as evidence to support that driving itself can precipitate arrhythmias
We will also review the postulated mechanisms by which driving can precipitate arrhythmias
Finally, we will compare guidelines from the USA, Europe, and UK in fitness to drive in patients with arrhythmias and ICDs
